name: **American BBQ Avocado (No Cook)**

name: **American BBQ Bacon (Air Fryer)**
instructions: Preheat air fryer to 390°F.
Arrange bacon in a single layer; air‑fry, flipping halfway, until cooked through and crisp at edges.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: All measurements are for 2 servings. Salt and pepper to taste. Use proper broth type per protein/diet.

name: **Chinese-style Bacon (Grill)**
instructions: Marinate: Whisk olive oil with key seasonings from the chinese-style profile; coat the bacon and marinate 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
Preheat grill to medium‑high (375–400°F). Oil the grates.
Grill the bacon 4–6 minutes per side until cooked through.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: All measurements are for 2 servings. Salt and pepper to taste. Use proper broth type per protein/diet.

name: **Greek Bacon (Crockpot)**
instructions: Marinate: Whisk olive oil with key seasonings from the greek profile; coat the bacon and marinate 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
Place bacon in the slow cooker with spices and liquids.
Cook on LOW 6–8 hours (or HIGH half the time) until tender.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: All measurements are for 2 servings. Salt and pepper to taste. Use proper broth type per protein/diet.

name: **Japanese Bacon (Crockpot)**
instructions: Marinate: Whisk olive oil with key seasonings from the japanese profile; coat the bacon and marinate 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
Place bacon in the slow cooker with spices and liquids.
Cook on LOW 6–8 hours (or HIGH half the time) until tender.

notes: All measurements are for 2 servings. Salt and pepper to taste. Use proper broth type per protein/diet.

name: **Korean-style Bacon (Stove Top)**
instructions: Marinate: Whisk olive oil with key seasonings from the korean-style profile; coat the bacon and marinate 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium‑high.
Sear the bacon 3–4 minutes per side until browned.
Add broth and simmer briefly to reduce and coat the ingredients.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: All measurements are for 2 servings. Salt and pepper to taste. Use proper broth type per protein/diet.

name: **Mexican Bacon (Oven Bake)**
instructions: Marinate: Whisk olive oil with key seasonings from the mexican profile; coat the bacon and marinate 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
Heat oven to 425°F. Line a sheet pan with parchment or foil.
Arrange bacon on the pan; roast until cooked through, flipping once if needed.
Add broth and simmer briefly to reduce and coat the ingredients.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: All measurements are for 2 servings. Salt and pepper to taste. Use proper broth type per protein/diet.

name: **Thai-style Bacon (Instant Pot)**
instructions: Marinate: Whisk olive oil with key seasonings from the thai-style profile; coat the bacon and marinate 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
Set Instant Pot to Sauté; warm a little oil.
Sear the bacon briefly; add liquids. Seal and pressure cook as directed.
Natural release 5 minutes, then quick release.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: All measurements are for 2 servings. Salt and pepper to taste. Use proper broth type per protein/diet.

Place lamb chops in the slow cooker with spices and liquids.
Cook on LOW 6–8 hours (or HIGH half the time) until tender.
Add broth and simmer briefly to reduce and coat the ingredients.
Garnish with mint leaves and serve.
notes: All measurements are for 2 servings. Salt and pepper to taste. Use proper broth type per protein/diet.
